text:
Makes sense, I guess we could say there are two main benefits: 1. no lock-in effect, allowing platform to grow and 2. duality of the codebase, in the way that it can be worked upon by both devs and non-devs.

We are both achieving second point by restricting and organizing the code in such way that it allows us to build additional tools on top of it that utilize this structure to offer simpler interaction with the code (visual editor).
However, we are doing it via DSL that has interoop with JS, while you are doing it by restricting JS.

Well this is all so exciting, I wish I had more to share but we also don't know yet exactly how will DSL perform -> but you are on our subscription list so we will notify you in couple of months when we release the first MVP! Looking forward to seeing how your solution develops :slightly_smiling_face:.
